intro: Calyptrostegia drummondii, commonly known as the Drummond's rock cress, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and fleshy, helping to reduce water loss. Calyptrostegia drummondii plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and provides nectar for pollinators.
